Module lanat

Class Group

java.lang.Object
lanat.Group
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArgumentAdder, CommandUser, GroupAdder, GroupUser, NamedWithDescription, ParentElementGetter<Group>, Resettable
public class Group extends Object implements ArgumentAdder, GroupAdder, CommandUser, GroupUser, Resettable, NamedWithDescription, ParentElementGetter<Group>

Argument Group

Represents a group of arguments. This is used to group arguments together, and to set a restriction between them. When a group is restricted, it means that only one argument in it can be used at a time.

Groups can also be used to simply indicate arguments that are related to each other, and to set a description to this relation. This is useful for the help message representation.

Groups can be nested, meaning that a group can contain other groups. This is useful for setting restrictions between arguments that are in different groups. For example, given the following group tree: 

            +-----------------------+
            |  Group 1 (restricted) |
            |-----------------------|
            | Argument 1            |
            +-----------------------+
                       |
          +---------------------------+
          |                           |
  +---------------+      +-------------------------+
  |    Group 2    |      |   Group 3 (restricted)  |
  |---------------|      |-------------------------|
  | Argument 2.1  |      | Argument 3.1            |
  | Argument 2.2  |      | Argument 3.2            |
  +---------------+      +-------------------------+
  • If Argument 1 is used, then none of the arguments in the child groups can be used, because Group 1 is restricted.
  • If Argument 3.1 is used, then none of the arguments in the rest of the tree can be used, because both Group 3 and its parent Group 1 are restricted.
  • If Argument 2.1 is used, Argument 2.2 can still be used, because Group 2 is not restricted. No other arguments in the tree can be used though.

    • Group

      public Group(@NotNull @NotNull String name, @Nullable @Nullable String description)
      Creates a new Argument Group with the given name and description. The name and descriptions are basically only used for the help message.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the group. Must be a unique name among all groups in the same command.
      description - The description of the group.
